Job Posting:172037 - Position: F25 Sony Music Entertainment Canada 172037B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 08/27/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 08/20/2025 01:46 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Sony Corporation Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 Sony Music Entertainment Canada 172037B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List At Sony Music Entertainment Canada Inc., we fuel the creative journey. We have played a pioneering role in music history, from the first-ever music label to the invention of the flat disc record. We have nurtured some of music's most iconic artists and produced some of the most influential recordings of all time. Today, we work in more than 60 countries, supporting a diverse roster of international superstars, developing and independent artists, and visionary creators. From our position at the intersection of music, entertainment, and technology, we bring imagination and expertise to the newest products and platforms, embrace new business models, employ breakthrough tools, and provide powerful insights that help our artists push creative boundaries and reach new audiences. In everything we do, we are committed to artistic integrity, transparency, and entrepreneurship. Sony Music Entertainment Canada Inc. is a member of the Sony family of global companies. Category: Creative Services Work Location: Liberty Village, Toronto Job Type & Duration: Full-time Internship, 4 Months from September to December 2025 Compensation: Paid Internship Work Arrangement: At least four (4) days per week in office, 9AM to 5PM, up to 37.5 hours a week Job Description The Creative Services team is responsible for designing and developing a wide range of materials to support our artists' brands around the world. We are looking for an exceptional intern to join the team on a short-term basis. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to observe and assist in the day-to-day activities of the team. The Role The Intern, Creative Services will: • Collaborate with the Creative Services team to conceptualize and design digital assets for domestic and international repertoire, websites, and social media content. • Translate design concepts into user-friendly interfaces with a focus on UX/UI principles and best practices. • Assist in the development and implementation of front-end web solutions using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other relevant technologies. • Support the maintenance and optimization of the website, ensuring consistency and adherence to brand guidelines. • Stay up to date on industry trends, emerging technologies, and design tools to enhance creative processes and outcomes. Other ad hoc duties as per department needs. • Benefits A modern, diverse, and innovative work environment. As well as an investment in your learning & development. Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Sony Music Entertainment Canada Inc. is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our People Experience team. Reasonable accommodation will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible. Job Requirements Ideal Candidate: • A well-rounded portfolio showcasing creative projects, including web design, user interfaces, and coding samples. • Completed a post-secondary or training program with a focus on Graphic Design, Web Development, Computer Science, or related field. • Proficiency in UX/UI design principles, with experience using design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, XD), Sketch, or Figma. • Strong coding skills with proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. • Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, WordPress, Shopify, and WCAG compliant practices is a plus. • Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment. • Proactive attitude, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Knowledge of the Canadian music landscape including record labels and independent artists. • N/A Citizenship Requirement APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/sonymusiccanada/jobs/8126422002?gh_src=pgiq1cz92us Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
